channel.title: Feedback standardization
channel.description:
This should help with the noble. But is primarily to make similar things consistent when possible and cut down on unnecessary information.
# Knight/Paladin/Physician/Alchemist/Chronomancer/Court Wizard for when the ability does nothing:
**[x] did not require assistance**
# Physician/Alchemist/Chronomancer after stopping an attack/delaying a death:
**You saved [x] from death!**
Bleeding/Poison for phys/alch is unchanged.
# All Killers After a failed attack:
**[x] Survived your attack!**
It doesn't matter why they survived. If you attack someone and the next day they aren't flipping (or reaped in the case of reaper) then you get this message. This is only when the attack resolves but doesn't lead to a death, occupy does not return this.
I'll add more if I come up with more, or if someone else

item.title: Feedback standardization
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
oh wow I see what you mean. i didn’t understand the point of the thread

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback standardization
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Excuse me? This post isn’t primarily about the Noble if that’s what you are talking about. The effects this has on him is (while not problematic really) not the reason why I posted this in the first place.

More just me wondering why there are so many different messages that mean the exact same thing and saying that it should just be one standardized message for consistency.

This doesn’t change how Investigators get feedback, this doesn’t change offensive classes, it’s not even THAT big a deal for the Noble, he still knows that whoever produced the result is good and still gets investigative results ect as normal.

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback standardization
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
It’s arbitrary in the sense that you could push the vagueness even further, where it only shows “good visit”, “evil visit”, or “undetermined visit” based on the faction of the visitor, and it’s not clear exactly why one should stop where you did

you could even just say “visited” or “not visited” lol

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback standardization
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
What do you mean?

All of these things mean the same thing for every class that can receive the feedback.

Classes where they don’t apply are receiving different feedback still.

DNR always just means your ability wasn’t applicable.

Saved from death always means the target was going to die and thanks to you didn’t.

Survived always means that the target obviously hasn’t flipped.

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback standardization
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
This seems rather arbitrary. Like I understand not showing more than one feedback of the same type, because that is consistent with what’s shown to players who get healed. But this is over the top and additionally prone to cause confusion since you will now have to learn what fits in what category. It’s like learning class types all over again.

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback standardization
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Like obviously I’m trying to combine similar feedbacks into each other for consistency, but there is a limit where that stops actually helping.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Feedback standardization
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
Actively moving to encourage such low-level gameplay over the alternative of needing to use social deduction is frankly baffling.

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback standardization
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
In no way is it a good game mechanic to place the focus on the wording of your logs instead of the actual implications your logs have on the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback standardization
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
“Probably” undersells the fact that being caught out on a lie not because it was a mistake but because you missed the specific wording is an experience that makes new players want to quit.

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback standardization

item.description:
I know it’s a thing and it can work sometimes. I just don’t like it, and it’s probably very frustrating for a new player.
